meanings.definition: A person who is the object of another's affection or desire.
meanings.sent1: She was his favorite teme, always bringing a smile to his face.
meanings.sent2: The movie star was the teme of many fans, admired for her talent and beauty.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten thought of the dog as its teme, following it around playfully.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the designer's latest creation became the teme of the season.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's teddy bear was her constant teme, providing comfort and companionship.

meanings.definition: To beget or give birth to offspring.
meanings.sent1: The mama bird will teme her eggs, keeping them warm until they hatch.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's sheep will teme lambs in the springtime.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion was said to teme new life in the barren land.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to teme colors onto the canvas, creating a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree was believed to teme wisdom and strength in those who sat beneath it.

meanings.definition: A group of animals, especially pigs, that are kept together.
meanings.sent1: The farmer fed his teme of pigs every morning before sunrise.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed visiting the petting zoo and seeing the teme of piglets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to join the teme of pigs in their mud bath.
meanings.sent4: The teme of cows and sheep grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The zookeeper took extra care of the teme of monkeys, ensuring they had plenty of toys to play with.
